body:
Another new champion released legit balanced and unbroken Rito?

http://plays.tv/video/57ac3da143e95de4fd/250-dmg-from-lvl-1-kled

Can someone please explain almost 300 damage from level 1 kled. Not even taking into account runes, masteries and grasp of the undying heal. I'd really love to hear this one justified.
P.S. Riot, you disappoint me every new champion release!

replies.body: can't any ad champ do that? like leesin would do way more dmg
300 dmg at lvl 1? theoretically "if" that was the case. how is a late game champion like nasus supposed to be competitive against someone who can do 300 dmg at just lvl 1. just think about that then
You let him whack you with like 4 autos and an ability. you could be tower hugging in fear and not take free damage
Every champ is op on release just look at ekko and illaoi their still overpowered and Riot haven't done much about it

ekko is a different issue, rito designed him as an assassin but tried to make him too fair, which in turn made him into a really shit assassin but a really good tank bruiser. ekkos been clubbed with the nerf hammer like 5 different times

What I don't understand, is that its usually so obvious that the upcoming champion is going to be broken _(cough. Malz. cough._). I sit here in my dressing gown watching 1 or 2 vids and reading the stats, and even I can tell instantly that they will be a problem on release. So if i can do it alone in my dressing gown, you would assume that the multi-billion dollar company that fricken made the champion would realise it too.

Which means either:

**1. Riot are compete imbeciles.**

or

**2. They know the champ will be broken but release them anyway for their own gain.**

Neither option fills me with confidence.
